intro: Erysimum ferganicum, commonly known as the Fergana wallflower, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other well-known flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and vibrant yellow or orange flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often covered in a fine layer of pubescence. Erysimum ferganicum is typically found in rocky or arid environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
